intro: Glockeria gracilis, commonly known as the slender glockeria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Aizoaceae. It is native to South Africa, where it typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. It produces small, star-shaped flowers that are usually pale yellow or white. Glockeria gracilis is a low-maintenance plant that thrives in full sun and well-draining soil.
